The source of the claim: The expert's verdict mentions that the claim originated from an article published on the Conservative Columns website. This aspect verifies the source of the claim.
Content analysis: The expert's verdict provides excerpts from the article, highlighting the specific statements made by Sasha Obama in the alleged anti-white rant. This aspect verifies the content of the claim.
Verification of the source: s credibility: The expert's verdict mentions that the Conservative Columns website is part of the "America's Last Line of Defense" network of junk news sites. This aspect verifies the credibility of the source and raises doubts about the authenticity of the claim.
Previous instances of false rumors: The expert's verdict mentions that the same fake news network had previously spread false rumors about Malia Obama being expelled from Harvard. This aspect highlights a pattern of spreading false information about the Obama family, further questioning the authenticity of the claim.
